Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Zvi Romm, Bialystoker Synagogue, 7-11 Bialystoker Place, New York, New York  10002.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gerson.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups
Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Aging

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the rent payable by a tenant enrolled in the senior citizen rent increase exemption program when a rent reduction order has been issued.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Maximum collectible rent from a tenant enrolled in the senior citizen rent increase exemption program.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Assembly to pass A.2242, which would amend the Real Property Tax Law to provide that the definition of income be offset by any unreimbursed medical and prescription drug expenses paid by a senior citizen for purposes of determining eligibility for Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) benefits, and further urging the New York State Senate to introduce and pass a companion bill.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Real Property Tax Law to exclude from the definition of income all unreimbursed medical and prescription drug expenses paid by a senior citizen. (A.6518)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of a posthumous presidential pardon of former boxing great John Arthur “Jack” Johnson for his racially-motivated conviction in 1913 and calling upon President George W. Bush to exercise his constitutional authority to grant a pardon in this case.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Member Gallagher.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Support of a posthumous presidential pardon of former boxing great John Arthur “Jack” Johnson.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 60th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz Concentration Camp in Poland on January 27, 1945.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 60th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz Concentration Camp in Poland on January 27, 1945.

Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.

Items.MatterName: Punishing dangerous and deadly drivers, particularly in relation to drivers who cause death or serious injury due to intoxication or criminal negligence.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the construction and maintenance of private sewers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Construction and maintenance of private sewers.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the Domestic Defense Fund Act of 2005, sponsored by Senator Hillary Clinton, which aims to increase the flow of Homeland Security funds directly to local communities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Domestic Defense Fund Act of 2005, Support

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the board of elections notifying city residents who voted by affidavit or paper ballot as to whether or not their vote was tallied, and if not, provide a reason.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Board of elections notifying city residents who voted by affidavit or paper ballot as to whether or not their vote was tallied.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the fire department pension fund medical board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Composition of the fire department pension fund medical board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city administrative code, in relation to the sale of toy or imitation identification badges and/or shields.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Sale of toy or imitation identification badges and/or shields.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the concept of the Underground Railroad Curriculum, a culturally relevant and inspiring educational tool that educates students about the contributions, accomplishments and struggles of African Americans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Supporting the concept of the Underground Railroad Curriculum.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disclosure in advertising with respect to theatre show times.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Disclosure in advertising with respect to theatre show times.

Items.Title: Resolution honoring the life and achievements of actor and activist Ossie Davis.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Honoring the life and achievements of actor and activist Ossie Davis.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the definition of campaign contribution under the Campaign Finance Law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Definition of campaign contribution under the Campaign Finance Law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to developing a watershed protection plan for the watershed/sewershed of Jamaica Bay.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Developing a watershed protection plan for the watershed/sewershed of Jamaica Bay.

Items.Title: A Local Law to create a temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.
Items.AgendaNote: Environmental Protection and Parks and Recreation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Create a temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to developing a comprehensive program for the remediation and reuse of brownfields.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Developing a comprehensive program for the remediation and reuse of brownfields.

Items.Title: Resolution strongly urging the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation to immediately develop and implement a total maximum daily load for nitrogen pollution into Jamaica Bay in order to preserve and protect this New York City jewel possessing exceptional ecological diversity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Develop and implement a total maximum daily load for nitrogen pollution into Jamaica Bay.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to expand the state Hate Crimes Law (Penal Law Article 485) to include bias motivated crime that is not directed at a particular person or location.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Expand the state Hate Crimes Law (Penal Law Article 485)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of ultra low sulfur diesel fuel and the best available technology for reducing the emission of pollutants by diesel fuel-powered private ferries.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Use of ultra low sulfur diesel fuel by diesel fuel-powered private ferries.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of ultra low sulfur diesel fuel and the best available technology for reducing the emission of pollutants by diesel fuel-powered ferries owned by, operated by or on behalf of, or leased by the city.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Use of ultra low sulfur diesel fuel by diesel fuel-powered ferries owned by, operated by or on behalf of, or leased by the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the penalties for the unlawful use of police uniforms, badges or emblems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increasing penalties for the unlawful use of police uniforms, badges or emblems.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Bush Administration to abandon its efforts to dismantle the current social security system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Bush Administration to abandon its efforts to dismantle the current social security system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Mayor’s Management Report to report on the allocation of funds and provision of services for each agency, where applicable, geographically by census tract, zip code, community district, council district and borough.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: MMR to report on the allocation of funds and provision of services for each agency, where applicable.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting S.11, the “Standing With Our Troops Act of 2005,” and calling upon the United States Senate to pass said bill and for the House of Representatives to introduce and pass similar legislation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Supporting the “Standing With Our Troops Act of 2005” (S.11)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Transit Authority to set a maximum safe speed for trains entering stations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: NYC Transit Authority to set a maximum safe speed for trains entering stations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate to enact legislation increasing the amount of the “military death gratuity” from approximately $12,000 to $100,000, and urging the President of the United States to sign such legislation into law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Increasing the amount of the “military death gratuity” from approximately $12,000 to $100,000.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to ensuring that eligible pre-trial detainees are allowed to register to vote and vote by absentee ballot.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Ensuring that eligible pretrial detainees are allowed to register to vote and vote by absentee ballot.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the City Council to hold a hearing on the impact of the Department of Education Superintendent Suspension Sites on schools that house such sites, including concerns regarding increased criminal incidents within the schools and surrounding neighborhoods, the academic placement of suspended students, and the adequacy of education for suspended students.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Impact of the Department of Education Superintendent Suspension Sites.

Items.Title: Resolution urging Mayor Michael Bloomberg to instruct the City Law Department to withdraw the appeal of Judge Doris Ling-Cohan’s decision in the case of Hernandez v. Robles, and instruct the Clerk of the City of New York to comply with the sum and substance of that decision by issuing a civil marriage license to any and every same-sex couple that is otherwise qualified to receive such license.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: City Law Dep't to withdraw the appeal of Judge Doris Ling-Cohan’s decision in the case of Hernandez v. Robles.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Millman A.1861, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the repair, construction and maintenance of athletic fields in the city of New York”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, repair, construction and maintenance of NYC athletic fields (A.1861).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright A.764, “An Act to amend the parks, recreation and historic law, in relation to vacating a trust.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation Law (A.764)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Dilan S.1081 and Assembly Member Robinson A.2014, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner George Black, or if he is deceased, to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from him or to their successor in interest, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1762, Lot No. 62 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: In Rem, George Black, Brooklyn

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Sabini S. 1246 and Assembly Member Lafayette A.2063, “An Act in relation to the control and stabilization of rents and rental agreements in certain retail commercial space in cities having a population of more than one million.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, relating to the control and stabilization or rent and rental agreements in certain retail commercial spaces in cities with one million or more. (S.1246, A.2063)

Items.MatterName: Annual disclosure of financial interests by certain officers and employees of the city of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative of the city of New York, in relation to precluding all uniformed city agencies from mandating that their employees comply with a uniform code that would require such person to violate or forego a practice of his or her creed or religion.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York charter in relation to the Office of Emergency Management, the New York City Police Department and other related agencies to organize a backlash mitigation plan to be implemented immediately following an event that may initiate backlash, bias, violence or hate crimes against protected groups as defined in the administrative code of the city of New York § 8-102 (22).
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Backlash Mitigation Plan

Items.Title:
Communication from the office of the City Clerk - Submitting the Certificate of the swearing in of Maria del Carmen Arroyo, as the new Council Member of the 17th Council District, Bronx County.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER MARIA DEL CARMEN ARROYO TAKING HER OATH OF OFFICE.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Maria del Carmen Arroyo, new Council Member of the 17th Council District, Bronx County.

Items.Title:

Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 69-71 Seventh Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3, shall be subject to review by the Council.
